intro: Eugenia waianensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian guava, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and red, fleshy berries. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a glossy surface. Eugenia waianensis is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and thrives in well-drained soils.
